header: A Story About a Big Banquet(A)

verse: One of those ·at the table [reclining; see 5:29] with Jesus heard these things and said to him, “·Blessed [Happy] are the people who will ·share in the meal [eat bread] in God’s kingdom [an allusion to the messianic banquet at the end of time; see 13:29; Is. 25:6–8].”
Jesus said to him, “A man gave a ·big [great] banquet and invited many people.
When it was time to eat, the man sent his ·servant [slave] to tell the guests [who had accepted the invitation], ‘Come. Everything is ready.’

“But all the guests [one after another; or in a similar manner] began to make excuses [a great offense in that culture]. The first one said, ‘I have just bought a field, and I must go look at it. Please excuse me.’
Another said, ‘I have just bought five ·pairs [yoke] of oxen; I must go and try them. Please excuse me.’
A third person said, ‘I just got married; I can’t come [while newly married men were exempt from certain duties (Deut. 24:5), that is not a valid excuse for offending the host].’

The master said to the servant, ‘Go out to the roads and ·country lanes [hedgerows], and ·urge [compel] the people there to come so my house will be full [those outside the city may refer to the Gentiles, who will come into the kingdom (see Acts 10—11)].
[For] I tell you, none of ·those [those men; referring to the three who refused] whom I invited first will ·eat with me [taste my banquet/dinner].’”

header: The Cost of Being Jesus’ Follower(B)
